title: Voices in the Quiet
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character hears faint voices or sounds that others cannot hear, creating confusion about reality.
description: Auditory hallucinations manifest as whispered voices that only the character can perceive. These voices may comment on actions, provide unwanted advice, or simply create a constant background of unintelligible murmuring that makes concentration difficult.
flavor_text: "Do you hear that? They're talking about us again... always talking."
image_prompt: A person sitting alone in a dimly lit room, hands covering ears, with ethereal whispered text floating around them in translucent speech bubbles, muted blue and gray color palette, mysterious atmosphere

title: Peripheral Shadows
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character sees shadowy figures or movements in peripheral vision that may not be there.
description: Dark, humanoid shapes appear at the edges of vision, vanishing when looked at directly. These shadow figures create persistent unease and hypervigilance, making the character constantly turn to check empty spaces.
flavor_text: "Something moved in the corner of my eye... but when I look, there's nothing there."
image_prompt: Dark silhouettes lurking at the edges of a person's peripheral vision, with the figure in center looking nervously over their shoulder, high contrast black and gray shadows, unsettling composition

title: Exposed Mind
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character believes others can hear their thoughts or that their mind is being read.
description: The delusion that one's thoughts are being transmitted and heard by others, leading to extreme self-consciousness and social withdrawal. Every private thought feels exposed and vulnerable to judgment.
flavor_text: "They know what I'm thinking. I can see it in their eyes - they can hear everything."
image_prompt: A person with transparent thought bubbles escaping from their head while others around them point and whisper, paranoid atmosphere, cool blue and purple tones, exposed and vulnerable feeling

title: Sensory Storm
card_type: Neurodevelopmental Disorders
setup: Character experiences normal sounds as painfully loud and overwhelming.
description: Auditory hypersensitivity causes everyday sounds to become unbearably intense. Conversations feel like shouting, footsteps thunder like earthquakes, and background noise creates a cacophony that makes functioning impossible.
flavor_text: "Make it stop... the world is too loud, too much, too everything."
image_prompt: A person crouching with hands over ears in a chaotic environment with visible sound waves, lightning bolts, and overwhelming sensory elements radiating outward, bright harsh colors, sensory overload visualization

title: What Is Real?
card_type: Dissociative Disorders
setup: Character questions whether their experiences and surroundings are real or imagined.
description: A profound sense of unreality pervades perception, making everything feel dream-like or artificial. The boundary between what's real and what's imagined becomes increasingly blurred and uncertain.
flavor_text: "Is this really happening? Am I dreaming? Nothing feels solid anymore."
image_prompt: A person reaching out to touch objects that appear translucent and dreamlike, with reality bending and warping around them, surreal colors shifting between real and unreal, questioning gesture

title: Scattered Mind
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character struggles with disorganized thoughts that jump between topics without clear connection.
description: Thoughts become disconnected and chaotic, jumping from topic to topic without logical progression. Conversations become difficult to follow as ideas fragment and lose coherence mid-sentence.
flavor_text: "I was talking about... wait, what was I... the blue car reminds me of Tuesday's rain..."
image_prompt: A person's head shown with scattered puzzle pieces floating around, broken mirrors reflecting different thoughts, chaotic mental fragments in bright conflicting colors, confused expression

title: Always Watched
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character feels constantly monitored and watched by unknown entities or people.
description: The persistent delusion of being under surveillance creates constant anxiety and hypervigilance. Every glance from a stranger, every camera, every reflection seems to confirm the conspiracy of observation.
flavor_text: "They're always watching... through the cameras, through the windows, through their eyes."
image_prompt: A person looking over their shoulder with multiple eyes watching from shadows, security cameras, and windows, creating a surveillance network, dark paranoid atmosphere with piercing gazes

title: Feeling Nothing
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character experiences complete emotional numbness and inability to feel or express emotions.
description: A profound absence of emotional experience leaves the character feeling hollow and disconnected. Joy, sadness, anger, and fear all become distant concepts rather than felt experiences.
flavor_text: "I should feel something... anything. But there's just... nothing."
image_prompt: A person sitting motionless with a blank expression, surrounded by colorful emotional scenes that appear drained of color around them, grayscale figure in a world losing its vibrancy

title: Lost Language
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character struggles to communicate coherently, words becoming jumbled and meaning unclear.
description: Speech becomes a chaotic mixture of unrelated words and phrases. Sentences start with one idea but end with completely different concepts, making communication nearly impossible.
flavor_text: "The purple elephant Tuesday washing machine thinks my grandmother's shoelaces are plotting revolution."
image_prompt: A person speaking with scrambled letters and random words tumbling from their mouth in chaotic arrangement, mixed-up alphabet soup of communication, frustrated confused expression

title: Frozen in Place
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character becomes unable to move or respond, frozen in a catatonic state.
description: Motor function becomes severely impaired, leaving the character immobile and unresponsive. They remain conscious but unable to initiate movement or respond to external stimuli.
flavor_text: "I want to move, to speak, to react... but my body won't obey."
image_prompt: A person frozen mid-motion like a statue, with motion blur around them showing the world continuing to move while they remain perfectly still, trapped in their own body

title: Who Am I?
card_type: Dissociative Disorders
setup: Character loses sense of personal identity and struggles to recognize themselves.
description: The fundamental sense of self becomes fragmented and unclear. Personal history, preferences, and even physical appearance feel foreign and unrecognizable.
flavor_text: "I look in the mirror and see a stranger. Is this really me? Who am I supposed to be?"
image_prompt: A person looking into a cracked mirror that shows multiple different reflections of themselves, each reflection showing a different identity or version, fragmented self-image

title: Hidden Patterns
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character sees meaningful connections and conspiracies in random events and coincidences.
description: Random events become interconnected in elaborate conspiracy theories. Coincidences are seen as evidence of hidden plots, and everyday occurrences take on sinister significance.
flavor_text: "Don't you see? The red car, the bird, the number 23... they're all connected. It's all part of the plan."
image_prompt: A person surrounded by photographs, newspaper clippings, and objects connected by red string in an elaborate conspiracy web, intense focused expression, detective-like obsession

title: Demanding Orders
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character hears voices giving specific commands or instructions that feel compelling to follow.
description: Auditory hallucinations take an imperative form, giving direct orders that feel impossible to resist. The voices demand specific actions with increasing urgency and authority.
flavor_text: "The voice is so clear, so commanding... I have to do what it says. I have no choice."
image_prompt: A person with hands pressed to their head, large bold commanding text floating around them like 'DO THIS' and 'OBEY NOW', overwhelming authoritative presence, internal struggle visible

title: Lost in Time
card_type: Neurocognitive Disorders
setup: Character loses track of time completely, unable to distinguish between minutes, hours, or days.
description: Temporal perception becomes severely distorted. Minutes feel like hours, days blur together, and the normal progression of time becomes meaningless and confusing.
flavor_text: "Was that yesterday or last week? How long have I been sitting here?"
image_prompt: A person surrounded by clocks showing different times, calendars with blurred dates, time flowing chaotically around them with temporal distortion effects, confused lost expression

title: Hearing Their Thoughts
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character believes they can hear other people's thoughts or that minds are connected.
description: The delusion of telepathic ability makes the character believe they can access others' thoughts. Internal assumptions about what others are thinking become perceived as actual telepathic communication.
flavor_text: "I can hear what they're really thinking... behind their fake smiles, I know the truth."
image_prompt: A person with thought streams and mental connections flowing between them and others, psychic energy visualization, concentrated listening expression, mystical telepathic atmosphere

title: False Physical Feelings
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character feels physical sensations that aren't there - bugs crawling, burning, or touching.
description: Tactile hallucinations create vivid physical sensations without external stimuli. The feeling of insects crawling on skin, burning sensations, or phantom touches become disturbingly real.
flavor_text: "Something's crawling under my skin... I can feel them moving, but there's nothing there."
image_prompt: A person scratching at their skin with phantom insects and crawling sensations visualized on their body, uncomfortable distressed expression, false tactile experiences manifesting visually

title: Special Mission
card_type: Bipolar and Related Disorders
setup: Character believes they have special powers, importance, or a divine mission to fulfill.
description: Delusions of grandeur create an inflated sense of self-importance and special abilities. The character believes they are chosen for a special mission or possess extraordinary powers.
flavor_text: "I've been chosen. The universe has given me a sacred mission that only I can fulfill."
image_prompt: A person standing confidently with divine light radiating around them, symbols of power and importance floating nearby, elevated commanding presence, grandiose self-perception

title: Everything Relates to Me
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character believes random events, TV shows, or conversations are specifically about them.
description: Normal events take on personal significance and meaning. Television programs, overheard conversations, and random occurrences all seem to contain hidden messages directed specifically at the individual.
flavor_text: "That news anchor is talking directly to me. The song on the radio - they're singing about my life."
image_prompt: A person pointing at themselves while arrows from various media sources (TV, radio, newspapers) point back at them, everything converging on their personal experience, self-referential focus

title: Not My Thoughts
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character believes thoughts that aren't their own are being inserted into their mind.
description: Foreign thoughts appear in consciousness that feel distinctly different from one's own thinking. These intrusive thoughts are experienced as being implanted by external forces or entities.
flavor_text: "These aren't my thoughts... someone is putting ideas in my head that don't belong to me."
image_prompt: A person with foreign thoughts being injected into their head like syringes, alien ideas floating into their mind, invasive mental intrusion, defensive posture against mental invasion

title: Wrong Reflection
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character sees distorted or different reflections in mirrors that don't match their appearance.
description: Mirrors show reflections that don't match the person's actual appearance. Features may appear distorted, aged, or completely different, creating profound confusion about self-image and identity.
flavor_text: "That's not me in the mirror... but it moves when I move. Who is that person?"
image_prompt: A person looking into a mirror that shows a completely different reflection - wrong face, wrong body, distorted features, shocking disconnect between self and reflection

title: Strange Odors
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character smells strong, unpleasant, or strange odors that others cannot detect.
description: Phantom odors create powerful olfactory experiences without any actual source. These smells are often unpleasant, metallic, or chemical in nature and can be constant or intermittent.
flavor_text: "Can't you smell that? It's everywhere... that horrible burning chemical smell."
image_prompt: A person reacting with disgust to phantom smells, holding their nose, with invisible odor waves and smell molecules floating around them, only they can perceive the offensive scents

title: Thoughts Being Stolen
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character believes their thoughts are being removed or stolen from their mind by external forces.
description: The experience that one's thoughts are being extracted or removed from their mind by external agencies. This leaves the person feeling mentally empty and robbed of their cognitive processes.
flavor_text: "My thoughts... they're taking them away. I can feel my mind being emptied."
image_prompt: A person with thoughts being visually sucked out of their head like smoke or energy, external forces stealing their mental content, empty confused expression, cognitive theft visualization

title: They're After Me
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character believes they are being actively persecuted, followed, or targeted for harm.
description: The firm belief that one is being deliberately harmed, followed, or persecuted by individuals or organizations. This creates constant fear and hypervigilance about potential threats.
flavor_text: "They're following me everywhere. I know they want to hurt me... I have to stay hidden."
image_prompt: A person running or hiding from menacing shadowy figures pursuing them, dark threatening atmosphere, being hunted visualization, paranoid fear and desperation

title: Repeating Words
card_type: Neurodevelopmental Disorders
setup: Character compulsively repeats words, phrases, or sounds they hear without conscious control.
description: Involuntary repetition of words, phrases, or sounds heard in the environment. This occurs without conscious intention and can interfere with normal communication patterns.
flavor_text: "Words words words... I can't stop repeating what I hear... repeating what I hear..."
image_prompt: A person with repeated words echoing around them in speech bubbles, same phrases multiplying and cascading, compulsive repetitive speech pattern visualization, frustrated expression

title: Watching Myself
card_type: Dissociative Disorders
setup: Character feels detached from themselves, as if watching their life from outside their body.
description: A persistent feeling of being detached from oneself, as if observing one's own thoughts, feelings, and actions from outside the body. Life feels like watching a movie of oneself.
flavor_text: "I'm watching myself live my life... like I'm floating above, seeing everything but not really there."
image_prompt: A person watching themselves from above in an out-of-body experience, ghostly observer viewing their own life, disconnected floating perspective, detached ethereal atmosphere

title: False Flavors
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character tastes strong, unpleasant, or metallic flavors when eating nothing or normal food.
description: Phantom taste sensations occur without any food or drink present. These tastes are often metallic, bitter, or chemical in nature and can be persistent and disturbing.
flavor_text: "Everything tastes like metal and poison... even water has this horrible bitter taste."
image_prompt: A person reacting with disgust to phantom tastes, tongue out, with bitter metallic taste sensations visualized around their mouth, false flavor experience, uncomfortable facial expression

title: Words Won't Come
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character finds it extremely difficult to speak or form coherent responses to questions.
description: Marked reduction in speech production and fluency. Responses become minimal, delayed, or completely absent, making communication increasingly difficult and sparse.
flavor_text: "I... I want to say... but the words... they won't..."
image_prompt: A person with empty speech bubbles above them, struggling to form words, mouth open but no words coming out, communication difficulty and silence visualization

title: Always on Guard
card_type: Trauma and Stressor-Related Disorders
setup: Character remains in constant state of alertness, scanning for threats that may not exist.
description: An enhanced state of sensory sensitivity and scanning for potential threats. The individual remains constantly alert and ready to react to perceived dangers in the environment.
flavor_text: "I have to stay alert... danger could come from anywhere at any moment."
image_prompt: A person with wide alert eyes, scanning environment intensely, radar-like scanning beams from their head, hyper-aware defensive posture, constant threat assessment mode

title: Strange Compulsions
card_type: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
setup: Character engages in strange, repetitive, or seemingly meaningless behaviors without clear reason.
description: Unusual and inappropriate behaviors that seem purposeless or bizarre to observers. These actions are performed without clear motivation and may be repetitive or ritualistic in nature.
flavor_text: "I have to touch every doorknob three times... I don't know why, but I have to."
image_prompt: A person performing strange repetitive actions - touching objects repeatedly, odd ritualistic movements, bizarre compulsive behavior visualization, confused but compelled expression

title: Too Much Information
card_type: Neurodevelopmental Disorders
setup: Character becomes overwhelmed by too much sensory and cognitive information processing at once.
description: Mental systems become overwhelmed by excessive information input, leading to cognitive shutdown or extreme confusion. Processing multiple streams of information becomes impossible.
flavor_text: "Stop... too much... can't process... everything is flooding in at once..."
image_prompt: A person overwhelmed with information streams flooding their mind - text, images, sounds all converging chaotically, mental overload visualization, holding head in overwhelmed distress

title: Fear of Judgment
card_type: Anxiety Disorders
setup: Character experiences intense fear and self-consciousness in social situations.
description: Persistent fear of social situations where the person might be judged, embarrassed, or humiliated. Physical symptoms like blushing, sweating, and trembling often accompany the psychological distress.
flavor_text: "Everyone is looking at me... they can see how nervous I am... I need to get out of here."
image_prompt: A person blushing and looking down nervously while others appear to be watching and judging, spotlight effect visualization, social scrutiny atmosphere, anxious body language

title: Mind in Overdrive
card_type: Bipolar and Related Disorders
setup: Character's thoughts move rapidly from topic to topic, making concentration difficult.
description: Thoughts move at an accelerated pace, jumping quickly from one idea to another. This mental acceleration makes it difficult to focus on any single topic for extended periods.
flavor_text: "My mind won't slow down... idea after idea, thought after thought, so fast I can't keep up..."
image_prompt: A person with rapid thought streams flowing quickly around their head, speed lines indicating mental velocity, energetic but scattered mental activity, fast-paced cognitive visualization

title: Heavy Heart
card_type: Depressive Disorders
setup: Character experiences persistent sadness and loss of interest in previously enjoyable activities.
description: A pervasive feeling of sadness, emptiness, or hopelessness that affects daily functioning. Activities that once brought joy now feel meaningless or require tremendous effort.
flavor_text: "Nothing seems worth doing anymore... everything feels gray and pointless."
image_prompt: A person sitting alone with a heavy, sad expression, world around them appearing muted and colorless, weight of sadness visualized as dark clouds or heavy atmosphere

title: Unwelcome Ideas
card_type: Obsessive-Compulsive and Related Disorders
setup: Character experiences unwanted, disturbing thoughts that feel foreign and distressing.
description: Unwanted thoughts, images, or urges that intrude into consciousness and cause significant distress. These thoughts are experienced as ego-dystonic and contrary to the person's values.
flavor_text: "Why am I thinking this? I don't want these thoughts... they keep coming back no matter what I do."
image_prompt: A person with dark, unwanted thought bubbles invading their mind against their will, pushing away disturbing mental intrusions, internal struggle against unwelcome ideas

title: Can't Start
card_type: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder
setup: Character knows what needs to be done but feels unable to begin or complete tasks.
description: Executive function difficulties create a mental block against starting or completing tasks, even when the person is fully aware of what needs to be done and wants to do it.
flavor_text: "I know I need to do this... I want to do it... but I just can't make myself start."
image_prompt: A person staring at a task or project, appearing frozen in indecision, with a mental wall or barrier between them and action, paralyzed by inability to begin

title: Never Good Enough
card_type: Anxiety Disorders
setup: Character feels intense pressure to perform flawlessly and fears making any mistakes.
description: An overwhelming need to perform perfectly in all endeavors, coupled with intense fear of making mistakes or falling short of impossibly high standards.
flavor_text: "It has to be perfect... if it's not absolutely perfect, then it's worthless."
image_prompt: A person meticulously working on something with magnifying glass attention to detail, surrounded by crumpled papers of 'failed' attempts, perfectionist pressure visualization

title: Too Much to Feel
card_type: Personality Disorders
setup: Character experiences emotions with such intensity that they become overwhelming and difficult to manage.
description: Emotions are experienced with extreme intensity, making them feel overwhelming and difficult to regulate. Small triggers can lead to disproportionately strong emotional responses.
flavor_text: "I feel everything so intensely... it's like my emotions are turned up to maximum volume."
image_prompt: A person drowning in a sea of colorful emotional waves, intense feelings visualized as overwhelming forces, struggling to stay afloat in emotional turbulence

title: Fake Success
card_type: Other Conditions That May Be a Focus of Clinical Attention
setup: Character believes their achievements are fraudulent and fears being exposed as incompetent.
description: Persistent feelings of being a fraud despite evidence of competence and achievement. The person attributes success to luck rather than ability and fears discovery of their perceived inadequacy.
flavor_text: "I don't deserve this success... everyone will find out I'm just pretending to know what I'm doing."
image_prompt: A person wearing a mask of confidence while looking insecure underneath, surrounded by achievements they don't feel they deserve, fraudulent self-perception visualization

title: Always Tired
card_type: Somatic Symptom and Related Disorders
setup: Character experiences persistent, overwhelming exhaustion that doesn't improve with rest.
description: Profound, persistent fatigue that significantly impacts daily functioning and doesn't respond to typical rest and recovery methods. Simple tasks feel monumentally difficult.
flavor_text: "I'm so tired... not just sleepy, but exhausted in my bones, my mind, my very soul."
image_prompt: A person appearing drained and exhausted, shoulders slumped, with energy meters showing empty, surrounded by tasks that feel impossibly heavy, chronic depletion visualization

title: Lost in the Haze
card_type: Neurocognitive Disorders
setup: Character struggles with memory problems and mental clarity, feeling like thinking through fog.
description: Cognitive functions feel clouded and unclear. Memory, concentration, and mental processing all feel slowed and obscured, like trying to think through a thick fog.
flavor_text: "I can't remember what I was just doing... my thoughts feel so cloudy and unclear."
image_prompt: A person with a foggy, clouded head trying to grasp at fading memories and thoughts, mental clarity obscured by cognitive mist, struggling to think clearly
